bonuses.leadin: This piece begins with the narrator asking “who rides, so late, through night and wind?” For 10 points each:
bonuses.leadin_sanitized: This piece begins with the narrator asking "who rides, so late, through night and wind?" For 10 points each:
parts: Name this Franz Schubert piece, which begins with the piano playing octave Gs in triplets. In this piece, a single vocalist portrays a narrator, a father, a son, and the title supernatural creature hunting the son.
The triplets beginning “Der Erlkönig” (EHRL-koh-nig) represent one of these animals, which the father and son ride on. Fast dances called galops represent the motion of these animals.

“Der Erlkönig” is an example of this Romantic genre of pieces written for voice and piano. Some of Schubert’s many pieces of this type are collected in Die Schöne Müllerin (dee SHOON-uh MOO-lur-ayn) and Winterreise (win-tur-AI-zuh).

"Der Erlkonig" is an example of this Romantic genre of pieces written for voice and piano. Some of Schubert's many pieces of this type are collected in Die Schone Mullerin (dee SHOON-uh MOO-lur-ayn) and Winterreise (win-tur-AI-zuh).
